newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Iran to raise oil refining output to 1.3 mln bpd.
newsitem.headline: Iran to raise oil refining output to 1.3 mln bpd.

text.p: Iran's Oil Minister Gholamreza Aghazadeh said on Saturday his country's oil refining output would soon rise to 1.3 million barrels per day (bpd).
"We will open soon -- in the coming months -- a refinery at the Strait of Hormuz with a 240,000 bpd," Aghazadeh told reporters after his arrival in Kuwait for an official visit.
He did not specify a date.
"We refine an amount of one million bpd in Iran and after work at the refinery (starts, refining output will be) 1.3 million bpd," he said through an interpreter.
Aghazadeh was apparently refering to a refinery in the Gulf port of Bandar Abbas that Iranian officials have said was due to come on stream in September 1997.
"We will open a project in northern Iran this month with a capacity of 350,000 tonnes (per year) of petrochemicals and plastics," he said when asked about new Iranian oil industry projects.
Iran is expetced to start commisioning the 500,000 tonnes Tabriz petrochemicals in the few coming weeks.

The Bandar Abbas refinery will produce 46,100 bpd of gasoline, 36,200 bpd of kerosene and jet fuel, 69,500 bpd of gas oil, 66,500 barrels of heavy fuel oil, 7,100 bpd of liquefied petroleum gas, 5,000 bpd of tar and 124 tonnes of sulphur a day, Iranian officials have said.
